articleinfo.releaseinfo: This is version 1.0 of Gnome xBill manual.

sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: Gnome xBill is a port of the original xBill to the GNOME desktop environment.

sect2.title: The Story of xBill

note.title: Source:
note.para: This section appeared in the original xBill.

sect2.para: Yet again, the fate of the world rests in your hands! An evil computer hacker, known only by his handle Bill, has created the ultimate computer virus. A virus so powerful that it has the power to transmute an ordinary computer into a toaster oven. (oooh!) Bill has cloned himself into a billion-jillion micro-Bills. Their sole purpose is to deliver the nefarious virus, which has been cleverly disguised as a popular operating system.
As System Administrator/Exterminator, your job is to keep Bill from succeeding at his task.

sect2.title: Overview
sect2.para: Gnome xBill is included in the GNOME-games package, which is part of the GNOME desktop environment. This document describes version &version; of Gnome xBill.

Simply stated, your mission in Gnome xBill is to maintain the stability of your computer systems. To do this you must splat the micro-Bills; restore any removed operating systems ; and dowse any sparks being sent from infected computers.

sect1.title: Entities you will see in Gnome xBill
sect1.para: Playing Gnome xBill requires interacting with a number of different items, in this section you will be introduced to each of them.

The overall goal is to maintain the stability of your computer system, therefore it makes sense that the first entity you are introduced is a computer. shows one of the computers you will start the game with, this computer has RedHat Linux installed on it but the computers you start the game with may have any other unix based operating system installed.

Some of the computers in your system will be connected by a black cable (see ), these computers are considered networked. Computers on a network are susceptible to a spark attack from an infected computer, this is explained in greater detail in .

sect1.para:
To run Gnome xBill, select

To start a new game of Gnome xBill select

When the new game begins you'll be presented with a screen like .This screen contains a number of computers each with an operating system installed on it.

The text in the left hand bottom corner of the screen is explained in After a short period of time micro-Bills will begin to attack your network.

sect2.title: Types of attacks
sect2.para:
When a micro-Bill arrives at one of your computers it will begin to uninstall the operating system as shown in After removing your operating system the micro-Bill will install the 'virus' on the pc. An infected computer will have the logo of a certain ubiquitous legacy operating system displayed on its screen. An infected computer is shown in .
Micro-Bill removing OS
Micro-Bill removing OS.
Infected computer
Infected Computer.

With the virus installed the micro-Bill will carry your previous OS off the screen. A micro-Bill carrying your operating system will look like you should try to splat the micro-Bill before he manages to carry the OS off screen.
micro-Bill removing OS
micro-Bill removing OS.

Once a networked computer has become infected it will periodically send sparks along it's network cable, once a spark arrives at it's destination the computer will instantly become infected. You can see a network spark travelling towards the HURD computer in
Network Spark
Network Spark.

sect2.title: Methods of attack prevention
sect2.para:
As the game progresses micro-Bills will begin to attack your network. In order to stop their assault you need to splat them. To splat a micro-Bill move the hand over them and click the first mouse button. If you hit the micro-Bill it will explode as in.
Splatted micro-Bill
Splatted micro-Bill.

After a micro-Bill has removed your OS he will begin to take it off screen. If you splat it the OS will fall onto the ground.
Removed OS on the ground
Removed OS on the ground.
You are then able to restore your OS by moving the mouse over the OS, pressing down the first mouse button and then dragging the OS to its computer.

note.title: NOTE
note.para: You can only restore operating systems to their original computer.

sect2.para: As noted earlier an infected computer will periodically send sparks along any network cables attached to it. To dowse these sparks you need to move the hand over the bucket, then press and hold the first mouse button. You can now drag the bucket over the spark and release the first mouse button to dowse it.

sect2.title: Gnome xBill Scoring system
sect2.para: Your score in Gnome-xBill is based on total uptime and the number of micro-Bills you kill. shows the scoreboard.

The scoreboard consists 4 blocks of text. The last two blocks are self explanatory. The first block is your micro-Bill status and is given by a ratio. The numerator of the ratio is the number of micro-Bills currently on screen and the denominator gives the number of micro-Bills off screen.
The second block of text is your network status indicator. The three values (from left to right) are:

listitem.para: Functioning computers, those computers which are still running their original (UNIX based) operating system
Uninstalled computers, those computers whose UNIX based operating system has been removed and are currently lacking any operating system.
Infected computers, those computers who have the virus instead of their original operating system.

sect2.para: Each micro-Bill splatted gives you 5 points. The remainder of your score is a function of total uptime. To maximise your uptime try to stop all the micro-Bills before they attempt to uninstall your operating systems.

If your score is high enough then when the game is over you will be entered in the Highscores (), to check the current high scores chose
Game Scores
